sepa_weekend:
SEPA standard = ğŸŒ SEPA.
Bank transfers have different processing times until they arrive at DFX.

ğŸŸ¢ On working days (during the day): on average 3â€“5 hours.
ğŸŸ¡ On working days (in the afternoon): usually the next working day.
ğŸŸ  On holidays: usually on the next working day.
ğŸ”´ On weekends: at the beginning of the next week,
usually on Monday. â¬…ï¸

âš ï¸ On Mondays, banks have the highest workload.
Everything that has arrived since Friday afternoon
is added to the Monday transfers. â˜ï¸

Therefore, not all transfers are often processed on Monday,
causing some to be delayed until Tuesday. ğŸ˜³

In extreme cases, a transfer made on Friday afternoon
may not arrive until Tuesday of the following week.
â€¼ï¸ This is not a single case for weekend transfers,
but rather a common phenomenon.

â˜ï¸ Accordingly, you will wait,
